message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CR

Reasoning: The paper discusses the role of AI in decision-making and the need for explaining AI-supported decisions, which are topics that are commonly discussed in the cs.AI sub-category. The paper also discusses the sensitivity of fairness in decision-making, which could fall under the cs.CY (computers and society) sub-category. The approach of designing evidence-based explanations for AI systems could also be relevant to the cs.HC (human-computer interaction) sub-category. The paper also mentions the importance of understanding how AI is part of a decision, which could be relevant to the cs.LG (machine learning) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses fairness-sensitive cases in the literature, which could be relevant to the cs.CR (cryptography and security) sub-category.
